column4: hey, im getting a strange error, when I do sudo command - I get an error.... "sudo: unable to resolve host gatsby",,, how can i fix this?
make sure your /etc/hostname and /etc/hosts file agree on the name of your computer
you can do it from recovery mode (select it on grub menu)
what if im trying to do - time app > textfile - will that work?
you want the output of time or the output of app in the log file
the output of time mainly - the app doesnt output anything :)
the output of time mainly - the app doesnt output anything :)
ok time can do it... use "time -o log.txt program"
thanks, didnt think of looking for that, should have
although man time is telling me it should
i suspect bash has built in time that is getting in the way use /usr/bin/time -o log.txt appname
that's a good idea, will have a look
yeah /usr/bin/time is working, time to add an alias :D
